alert.note: Alert for Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 26 at 3:49AM CDT until March 26 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Coosa County in east central Alabama... * Until 445 AM CDT. * At 348 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Gap Of The Mountain, or 7 miles north of Clanton, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Goodwater, Kellyton, Weogufka, Stewartville, Hanover, Bradford, Strickland Crossroads, Bentleyville, Unity, Parkdale, Marble Valley, Moriah, Hatchet, Crewsville, Mitchell Lake, Lay Lake and Paint Creek. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
